value.0: Back again, <FirstName>? What brings you back to Berna?
Hey, there. You're one of the students here at the Academy, aren't you?
I'm Berna, an instructor here at the Academy. I work with the newbies but it looks like you're about to graduate. What can I do for you?
Goodbye, <FirstName>.
Of course. We instructors are here to give guidance to the students, after all. How else will you complete your training?
Goodbye, <FirstName>.
So you have heard the rumors as well? You should focus on your studies and not idle gossip.
Lady Aribeth is no doubt seeking a cure, but there has been no official word. And spreading rumors about a cure being stored here at the Academy is dangerous.
It draws unwanted attention. The people are desperate for a cure - so desperate they might even attack the Academy itself if they feel we have one.
I know the quarantine of the city has done little to stop the affliction from spreading, though it has bred mistrust and fear among the people.
Lady Aribeth does her best to keep the peace, but the rumors are beginning to fly. People suspect some dark evil is behind the Wailing Death.
Soon the panic may lead to open rebellion. I pray we of the Academy are not forced into battle against the citizens of Neverwinter. They are the very people we are supposed to protect!
Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande is a Paladin of Tyr. She may be young, but she has already proven her courage and her devotion to both Neverwinter and Tyr.
Lord Nasher Alagondar himself has given Lady Aribeth the task of saving Neverwinter from the Wailing Death.
She's actually here at the Academy right now, in the south assembly hall. Once you've finished your training you can go to meet her.
Just head through the exit in the southwest corner of this room. The Academy training rooms are all in the hallway beyond.
Once you finish your training you can go meet Aribeth in the south assembly hall.
Well, if you change your mind I'll be right here to help you out. Is there anything else I can do for you?
To use your journal, simply left-click on the Journal box beneath your character portrait or press the J key on your keyboard. Go ahead and do that now... it won't end our conversation.
This brings up your journal entries for the current chapter. Right now you should see two quests in your journal: Academy Training and Speaking to Berna.
Go ahead and click on the Speaking to Berna entry to get the detailed description of that entry. You can click on an entry to bring up more details at any time.
Sure, I'll go over it one more time.
Go ahead and close your journal now. You can do this by hitting the J on your keyboard or by clicking the journal icon under your character portrait.
Now I'm going to update your journal. Open your journal again. You'll see the Speaking to Berna entry has been moved. It's now in the Completed Quests section of your journal.

Notice that on the top of the journal are tabs for your quests, your completed quests and a section where you can make your own notes. As I already mentioned, the Speaking To Berna entry is now under the completed quests tab.
Click on the entry. Notice how it's changed to tell you the quest is now over. That's about it for the journal. Do you want me to go on to the map tutorial now?
Okay, first make sure your journal is closed. Now, to use your map, left-click the MAP box beneath your character portrait or press M on your keyboard. The top of the map is always north.
Go ahead and do that now. Your location on the map is marked by an arrow, and the arrow points in the direction you are facing. Do you understand so far?
I'll go over it again.
The arrow keys on the top of the map let you zoom in or out. Maps will fill in as you explore an area. You can leave the map up to help guide you as you are adventuring.
You will also see that there are small pins tacked onto the map. These are your map notes; they mark important locations in an area. Simply move your mouse over one of the pins to read the notes.
You can add your own map notes by clicking the PIN in the upper left corner of the map screen, then clicking the area on the map where you wish to add the note.
I'll go over it one more time for you.
That's it as far as the map and journal go. You can close your map now if you want. Just click the MAP icon below your character sheet or hit M on your keyboard.
Farewell.
May I ask you some questions?
Farewell.
Do you know anything about a cure for the plague?
What can you tell me about the Wailing Death?
Tell me about Lady Aribeth.
Where can I go to complete my training?
Not interested.
Sure.
Me not get it.
Even me understand that.
Could you repeat that?
Okay, I understand that.
No. Me need you say that last stuff again.
No. Can you repeat that last part about the journal again?
Yes.
No.
Yes.
Me got lost in that.
You lost me.
Anything else?
